Getting Started

Source: vignettes/enaR.Rmd
enaR.Rmd

enaR is an R function library for analyzing (ecosystem) network models. It helps you apply algorithms developed for Ecosystem Network Analysis to better understand the structure, function, and behavior of ecosystems. enaR was designed to bring together the many algorithms for ENA, including those developed by the Patten and Ulanowicz schools of analyses, and better connect them to the rapidly developing tools and analyses for network science (such as the R packages like statnet and iGraph). ENA has potential applications for network science beyond ecosystems, and we are excited to see your applications and future development of this tool.

Documentation to Get You Started

  • Vignette (tutorial)

  • Scholarly Introduction – Borrett & Lau (2014) enaR: An r package for Ecosystem Network Analysis. Methods in Ecology and Evolution 5: 1206-1213.

  • Comprehensive R Archival Network

Developed by Matthew K. Lau, S.R. Borrett, D.E. Hines, P. Singh.
